snippet: Dutee Chand, India’s 100-meter champion in the 18-and-under category, was barred from competing against women because of naturally elevated testosterone levels.
abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column profiles Dutee Chand, India's 100-meter champion in the 18-and-under category who has been barred from competing against women because of naturally elevated testosterone levels; Chand has a condition called hyperandrogenism, causing her body to produce natural levels of testosterone so high that they place her in the male range in the eyes of international track and field.
lead_paragraph: Dutee Chand, India’s 100-meter champion in the 18-and-under category, was barred from competing against women because of naturally elevated testosterone levels.

headline.seo: Sprinter Dutee Chand Challenges Ban Over Her Testosterone Level
headline.main: Fighting for the Body She Was Born With
headline.print_headline: Fighting for the Body She Was Born With
